items.title: Presets support, more warpings mods and support for their automation
items.body:
1. Add the ability to save and use presets
2. Add more warp modes, for example from the Xfer Serum synthesizer
3. Add the ability to automate warpingknobs. In Bitwig Studio, for example, they are not displayed in the instrument panel

items.title: It is not possible to press play / pause im Ableton while using the Plugin.
items.body: Normally I can use the spacebar in Ableton to press pause and play while using a plugin. When I click on a parameter in the Wolf Shaper plugin, this no longer works while working in the plugin. I then have to press an area in Ableton again for the space bar to work again.

items.title: vst3 version of the plugin shows up as missing when transferring project from Win to Mac
items.body:
Hi! I tried to open an Ableton project I'm working on my Windows 10 PC on my Macbook, and Wolf Shaper shows up as missing (all the other plugins show up just fine). I tried it in an empty project again, also the other way around, and it also wasn't working. I'm only using default installation paths so normally it should find the plugin no problem. 
When I tried this with the vst2 version of the plugin (even manually renamed the dll on Windows to match the one on the Mac) it was working just fine and Ableton recognized it as the same plugin and loaded it without problems.

items.title: Fix values outside of graph not being clipped
items.body: Fixes #169

items.title: Input signals exceeding the graph are not clipped off.
items.body:
Not sure how to verbally explain this in more detail than in the title.
I noticed this when I was trying to use Wolf Shaper as a soft-clipper but no amount of input gain would make the signal actually clip.

Here's a screen recording demonstrating the issue: 
https://cloud.sandelinos.me/s/8o5RD6d64m82YrP

items.title: AU (Audio Unit) support
items.body:
Wolf Shaper is not recognized by Waves Version 14 StudioRack Plugin VST3 feature.   I am using Logic Pro which only recognizes the AU format for plugins.  I was hoping to access WolfShaper VST3 using the Waves StudioRack V14 Plugin. By fixing this problem or creatibg an AU version of Wolf Shaper you will access a large customer base.
Thank you
Watersland

items.title: Stuck at max volume on latest version from github
items.body: Running `wolf-shaper-git` from AUR, on the latest version, in Ardour 7 on Linux, and any track that I put wolf shaper on has its volume meter maxed out, and no audio comes thru from any tracks at all. I think for some reason wolf shaper is outputting a constant +1.0 or -1.0 value, which causes all audio to get clipped to the max/minimum. I switch to the non-AUR build which I think is the latest release build, and that one works, so this must have been a fairly recent issue.

items.title: VST3 plug-in not showing
items.body:
I installed universal plug-in on MacBook Pro M1 with macOS 12.6.1 (Monterey) and Cubase 12 running with Rosetta 2.
In Cubase 12, VST2 plug-in is showing but VST3 is not.

items.title: Fix dsp/gui inconsistencies and improve generic UI
items.body:
Changes should be self-explanatory, but to summarize:
- DSP and UI should start with the same state, otherwise UI will show incorrect values
- Enumerations are nice so hosts that use generic UI can show those as the real parameter values instead of just numbers
- The gain controls were set as logarithmic, but no log scale was ever in use in the GUI, removed the hint to make DSP side behave the same as the UI does

items.title: UI window can't be resized in qtractor
items.body:
I tried wolf-shaper-1.0.0 in QTractor.
The window is created too large. Bottom 10% of it is clipped.
The window can't be resized using a mouse.
It shows the "resize" cursor but the window doesn't resize.

FreeBSD 13.1

items.title: Cleanup and high-dpi fixes
items.body:
A little bit of cleanup and initial implementation for high-dpi.
I tried to adjust things as much as possible, might have missed some details so please review.

Added a few other extra bits for using wolfshaper as modgui, it doesnt affect the regular desktop build.

Regarding high-dpi, this is under regular 1x scale:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1334853/209880522-d4428ea7-4573-4fa5-8abf-7db08abfbe87.png)

and just for the sake of it for testing, here is 10x scale:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1334853/209880575-e1744183-d8d3-40ae-9c7d-7b996d01c7a5.png)

(not sure how github will handle such image, pardon any oddities)

when scaling up like this we can easily spot the small 1px inconsistencies :scream: :joy:

items.title: [Feature request] Adjustable grid with snap option
items.body: Quite often I find myself trying to do symmetric proportions of the shape and it's hard to do without snap to grid option, and grid would need adjustable number of vertical/horizontal lines.

items.title: 2x oversampling works better than 4-16x oversampling in some circumstances
items.body:
Reported by @unfa: [SSR-2021-09-17_12.55.07.webm](https://github.com/wolf-plugins/wolf-shaper/assets/23723605/d0ac8c56-ac9c-461d-9431-388665602891)

I'm not sure, but it seems like the lowpass filter becomes less steep at higher sample rates, which causes aliasing.

labels.name: windows
labels.description: The issue is encountered in the Windows build of the plugin

items.body: I am using Ableton live 9 on Windows which accepts vst2 plugins but when I load Wolf-Shaper, all I get is a black square as the plugin and ableton instantly shuts down. I tried using previous versions but that ended up shutting my entire computer off. If you need any more information or have information on how to fix this, please let me know.

items.title: Tweak project layout
items.body:
This PR modifies the file structure of the project to make it a bit more conventional:

- Replace `plugins/wolf-shaper` directory with `/src`
- Move `plugins/wolf-shaper/Libs/` directory to `/libs`
- Move Chivo font to `/resources`
- Move Screenshot.png to the `/docs` folder
- Put shell scripts in `/tools`
- Remove the Debian package from the source tree. On Debian and derivated systems, the plugin can be installed through other means, such as the [KXStudio repositories](https://kx.studio/Repositories).

items.title: Implement right-click menu as widget instead of window
items.body:
Hi! here is my reimplementation of RightClickMenu as a widget instead of a window.

Some notes:

- I named it MenuWidget instead of RightClickMenu, since it can be used as a generic drop-down menu
- I added a clang-format file. I only used it to format MenuWidget to fit the style of the rest of the code, but thought I'd include it since it might be useful to have project-wide formatting.
- My variable names use snake_case instead of camelCase, can change that if necessary
- I had to use chivo bold as the font. It seems the default font was disabled in upstream DPF because it wouldn't display any text unless I specified a font. That meant I had to change from a ✓ to a regular dash because the font didn't seem to include that glyph. I think it still looks ok tho
- We have to call a method on the top-level UI class to close the widget if the mouse goes out of bounds. With this configuration, instead of testing whether the mouse is outside of some bounds, we could just make it close whenever something else is clicked (like a control). I've left it testing if the mouse goes out of bounds but I don't think it would be hard to change the behaviour.
- If window-manager based window resizing is implemented, then it might break the mouse bounds checking in the case where a menu is shown while the window is being resized. I think there is probably a callback/event we can use to fix that tho.

items.title: Add CMake support
items.body:
This PR allows building the plugin using CMake.

Thanks @jpcima for adding CMake support in DPF :)

items.title: HAVE_LIBLO is defined but is never used in C code
Set the UI as user resizable
items.body: Fixes https://github.com/wolf-plugins/wolf-shaper/issues/109. Probably fixes https://github.com/wolf-plugins/wolf-shaper/issues/54 as well.

items.title: Get rid of Wolf Common
items.body:
This submodule is annoying to work with. Let's keep the files directly in the wolf-shaper repo instead.

This PR also fixes a few unrelated compiler warnings.

items.title: Revamp website
items.body:
Right now, the website is based on the default Asciidoctor stylesheet: https://wolf-plugins.github.io/wolf-shaper/

This theme doesn't really fit the aesthetic of the plugin.

items.title: Plugin calls mutex.unlock() even if locking fails?
items.body:
This line of code: 

https://github.com/wolf-plugins/wolf-shaper/blob/b5c8c457abbe2212ce20644895be4243a2ba5740/plugins/wolf-shaper/WolfShaperPlugin.cpp#L312

is followed by:

https://github.com/wolf-plugins/wolf-shaper/blob/b5c8c457abbe2212ce20644895be4243a2ba5740/plugins/wolf-shaper/WolfShaperPlugin.cpp#L403

I assume we should call `unlock()` only when `tryLock()` returns `true`.
